com.here.android.mpa.routing

Class RouteWaypoint

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.here.android.mpa.routing.RouteWaypoint

  • public final class RouteWaypoint
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a waypoint to be used in a route calculation. A RouteWaypoint contains the GeoCoordinate location, as well as additional information, such as the actual road position and whether it is a stop in the route.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  RouteWaypoint.Type
      Represents different types of waypoints.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RouteWaypoint

        public RouteWaypoint(GeoCoordinate coordinate)
        Public Constructor. The specified location coordinate is used to set the original position of this waypoint.

    • Method Detail

      • setWaypointType

        public RouteWaypoint setWaypointType(RouteWaypoint.Type type)
        Sets the waypoint type. By default the waypoint is a STOP_WAYPOINT.
        Parameters:
        type - waypoint type, see RouteWaypoint.Type for valid values.
        Returns:
        The modified RouteWaypoint itself.

      • getWaypointType

        public RouteWaypoint.Type getWaypointType()
        Gets the Waypoint Type, see RouteWaypoint.Type for valid values
        Returns:
        The current Type.

      • setOriginalPosition

        public RouteWaypoint setOriginalPosition(GeoCoordinate position)
        Sets the original position, which identifies position of this waypoint off the road, such as the exact location of a building.

        The original position is mandatory for determining the side of street during arrival, and to let the calculated route approach the correct side of street, especially when there there is a physical or logical lane divider on the road.

        Parameters:
        position - to be set as the original position
        Returns:
        The modified RouteWaypoint itself.

      • getOriginalPosition

        public GeoCoordinate getOriginalPosition()
        Gets the original position of this waypoint.
        Returns:
        The original position

      • setNavigablePosition

        public RouteWaypoint setNavigablePosition(GeoCoordinate position)
        Sets the waypoint's position to be used for route calculation.

        By default, this is the same as the geocoordinates provided during construction of this RouteWaypoint. In other words, the navigable position is the same as the original position by default.

        Parameters:
        position - to be set as the navigable position
        Returns:
        The modified RouteWaypoint itself.

      • getNavigablePosition

        public GeoCoordinate getNavigablePosition()
        Gets the navigable position. The navigable position is used for route calculation.
        Returns:
        The navigable position
